page.title: 05LEISURE-SPORT-ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: This area,being rural, does not offer many organised leisure activities and many people travel outside the area to take part in sporting and leisure pastimes.Many people use the golf and squash facilities in near by St,Neots and there is one squash court in Great Paxton itself.The river encourages fishing while many spend their free time gardening and doing maintenance and improvement jobs in their homes. There is a National Housewives Register group which meets fortnightly to discuss varied issues and to hear talks by visiting speakers.Some adults belong to the Round Table and Ladies Circle-groups which do charitable work.There are village football teams and a soft ball team. The local public houses are well used, as are the
